title.narrative: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) Country Programme for Pakistan - Illicit Trafficking and Border Management Sub-Programme

description.narrative: This United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) project aims to strengthen the capacity of law enforcement and criminal justice agencies to effectively overcome the challenges related to human trafficking in Pakistan. The project will encompass the development of research reports on the emerging trends and patterns, the provision of legislative assistance, in addition to delivering specialized trainings to enable capacity-building for government ministries and departments, law enforcement and criminal justice agencies, social services, and civil society organizations.

title.narrative: Conservation of the 3rd-Century BC Indus Valley Civilization Collection at the National Museum in Karachi

description.narrative: The National Museum possesses the worlds largest collection of objects from the Indus Valley civilization. This project, which involves objects conservation, directly supports the Embassy's efforts to counter violent extremist narratives with a counter-narrative of a multi-ethnic, multi-religious Pakistan rooted in a pre-Islamic culture.

title.narrative: Conservation of the Mid-19th-Century Frere Hall in Karachi

Department of State, Migration and Refugee Assistance

title.narrative: Promotion and Protection of Rights of Bonded Laborers in the Punjab Province

description.narrative: The Insan Dost Association is enhancing the protection and empowerment of bonded laborers in 15 highly affected Punjab districts via activation and capacity building of the dormant District Vigilance Committees to implement the Bonded Labor Abolition Act. Insan Dost is enhancing coordination and collaboration among civil society organizations and bolster the capacity of district and provincial administrations to fight human trafficking and assist victims. More specifically, Insan Dost is surveying brick kiln workers, design responsive interventions, and establishing mechanisms for monitoring workplaces and lodging complaints within the District Vigilance Committees. Insan Dost is raising the awareness and capacity of brick kiln workers to organize and advocate for their rights; assisting workers to access basic state benefits and services, including shelter and vocational training; and reducing their vulnerability. Insan Dost is advocating for increased access to victim rehabilitation programs and a more streamlined process for obtaining benefits via the Bonded Labor Fund.

title.narrative: Preservation of Neolithic and Other Archaeological Objects in the Mehrgarh Museum of Balochistan in Quetta

description.narrative: The Mehrgarh Museum preserves and displays objects from the paleolithic period to the present era, including objects from the neolithic (circa7000 circa 2000 B.C.) site of Mehrgarh, one of the oldest archeological sites in South Asia. This project involves the cataloging and digitization of the collection, updates to the museum's exhibits, and conservation training for staff.
